title: Boy, 4, approached by man at NSW pool
text:
Police are seeking to identify a man after a four-year-old boy was approached twice at a swimming centre in the Hawkesbury region.

The boy was with his family at a fitness centre in South Windsor about 4.40pm on Thursday when a man grabbed the child's arm as he walked past, police were told.

A family member intervened and the man walked away.

Shortly after, the boy and his 23-year-old brother were confronted by the man when they entered the toilets.

The man acted inappropriately towards the boy.

The brother intervened and took the boy back to their mother.

The incidents were reported to police but by this time the man and the family had left the fitness centre.

Police are seeking a man who they believe can help with their inquiries.

He is described as being between 40 and 50 years, of Asian appearance, about 170cm tall and with a chubby build.
